newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Optus says pay TV losses A$74 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Optus says pay TV losses A$74 mln.

text.p: Optus Communications Pty Ltd, Australia's second largest telecommunications group, said its shares of losses from its 46.5 percent-owned pay television operator Optus Vision was A$74.0 million.
Optus said its direct investment in Optus Vision was A$372 million at June 30. This was more than half of the A$605 million it has committed to invest in Optus Vision by June 1997.

"Optus Communications is very pleased with its investment and the level of demand from the Australian public has confirmed our belief in the long term success of this investment," chief executive Zygmunt Switkowski said in a statement.

Continental CableVision Inc, which is currently merging with U.S. West, also owns 46.5 percent of Optus Vision. Seven Network Ltd and Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd own the remainder. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
